%md ## Performing Neighborhood Aggregation GraphX has a mechanism to do **Neighborhood Aggregation** at each neighborhood level in the form of the **aggregateMessages** method. It does it in two steps: 1. In the first step (first function of the method), messages are send to the destination vertex or source vertex (similar to the Map function in MapReduce). 2. In the second step (second function of the method), aggregation is done on these messages (similar to the Reduce function in MapReduce). Consider the following dataset:

Follower Followee
John Christ
Pat Christ
Gary Christ
Kim Buddha
Takeshi Buddha

We want to find out how many followers each vertex has. Let us load this data in the form of two lists - _verticesList_ and _edgesList_. Performing Neighborhood Aggregation

GraphX has a mechanism to do Neighborhood Aggregation at each neighborhood level in the form of the aggregateMessages method.

It does it in two steps:

  1. In the first step (first function of the method), messages are send to the destination vertex or source vertex (similar to the Map function in MapReduce).
  2. In the second step (second function of the method), aggregation is done on these messages (similar to the Reduce function in MapReduce).

Consider the following dataset:

Follower Followee
John Christ
Pat Christ
Gary Christ
Kim Buddha
Takeshi Buddha

We want to find out how many followers each vertex has.

Let us load this data in the form of two lists - verticesList and edgesList.
